item.title: Maharashtra Govt Hikes Charges For High Security Number Plates, Check New Rates Here - News18
item.description:
Maharashtra Increases Fees for High-Security Number Plates – New Rates Revealed

Publication Date: December 26, 2024, Source: News18 Hindi

Car and bike owners in Maharashtra will now have to pay more for High-Security Number Plates (HSRP) for vehicles registered before April 1, 2019, following a recent announcement by the Maharashtra Transport Department.

  • The installation cost for two-wheelers (motorcycles, scooters, tractors) is Rs 531.
  • The cost for three-wheelers (auto-rickshaws) is Rs 590.
  • Larger vehicles (cars, buses, trucks, and more) will now incur a fee of Rs 879.
  • HSRP includes unique identification features to enhance security against forgery.
  • The Maharashtra Transport Department has activated a payment link for the new rates.
“The High-Security Registration Plate (HSRP) is designed to be tamper-proof and difficult to duplicate.”

The state transport department has provided an appointment facility on its website for installing HSRP on old vehicles, aiming to improve vehicle registration security.

item.title: IPS Officer hailing from Jammu and Kashmir promoted to senior Time Scale - Cross Town News

item.title: Indian CEO warns people not to fall for 'startup romance', shares harsh reality - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Indian CEO warns of the harsh realities behind 'startup romance'

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Radhika Gupta, CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, warns against the glamorization of startup culture, highlighting the difficult realities that come with entrepreneurship.

  • Startup culture in India has significantly grown, attracting many young individuals towards entrepreneurship.
  • Gupta advises against the 'startup romance' perception that depicts startup life as easy and glamorous.
  • She outlines the harsh truths of startup life, including execution pain, budget constraints, and the stress of constant rejection.
  • The reaction on social media is mixed, with differing opinions on the risks and rewards of starting a business.
“Startup reality hits soon. It means painful execution, limited budgets and even more limited working conditions...” - Radhika Gupta

This warning from the CEO encourages prospective entrepreneurs to realistically evaluate the challenges of startup life, despite its appealing facade.

item.title: CCPA fines three coaching institutes for misleading UPSC exam claims | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
CCPA fines three coaching institutes for misleading UPSC exam claims

Date: Dec 26, 2023

Source: PTI

The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed penalties totalling ₹15 lakh on three coaching institutes for making misleading advertisements about their success rates in civil services examinations.

  • Vajirao & Reddy Institute and StudyIQ IAS were each fined ₹700,000.
  • Edge IAS was penalised ₹100,000 for deceptive claims regarding their results in the UPSC Civil Services Examinations.
  • The CCPA found that the institutes misrepresented the effectiveness of their courses by concealing that successful candidates had only enrolled in Interview Guidance Programs.
  • The CCPA has issued 45 notices to various coaching institutes for misleading advertisements, totaling ₹71.6 lakh in penalties from 22 institutes to date.
The advertisements that deliberately conceal important information are classified as misleading and subject to penalties under the Consumer Protection Act, 2019.

This action highlights the CCPA's commitment to curbing misleading practices in the educational sector and protecting consumer rights.

item.title: AAP Says Will Ask INDIA Bloc To Remove Congress From Alliance If... - NDTV
item.description:
AAP Threatens to Remove Congress from INDIA Alliance Over Ajay Maken Controversy

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a major setback for opposition unity, the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has announced intentions to request Congress's removal from the INDIA alliance if it does not take action against its Delhi leader, Ajay Maken.

  • AAP accuses Congress of facilitating BJP's electoral success ahead of the Delhi Assembly elections.
  • Allegations arise that Ajay Maken's statements align with BJP's agenda.
  • The face-off follows previous cooperation between AAP and Congress during the Lok Sabha elections.
  • AAP demands action against Maken within 24 hours or will seek Congress's removal from the alliance.
“All limits have been crossed,” said MP Sanjay Singh regarding Maken’s comments.

This situation highlights growing tensions within the opposition, as AAP asserts its stance against Congress's perceived alignment with BJP interests.

item.title: Over 260 Canadian Colleges, Rs 60 Lakh Per Person: Trafficking Of Indians Into US Under ED Lens - News18
item.description:
Over 260 Canadian Colleges Under Investigation for Trafficking Indians to the US

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: News18

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating a human trafficking and money laundering scheme involving 262 Canadian colleges, accused of facilitating the illegal migration of Indians to the US through student visas. Allegations point to charges of up to 60 lakh INR per person for crossing the border.

  • The investigation is linked to a tragic incident where a family died while attempting to enter the US illegally from Canada.
  • ED's probe started from an FIR against main accused Bhavesh Ashokbhai Patel.
  • Patel allegedly led a conspiracy to traffick Indians via falsified college admissions in Canada.
  • Indians were charged between Rs 55-60 lakh for this service.
  • The investigation has revealed extensive networks involving thousands of agents connecting students with colleges.
  • In recent searches, the ED froze significant amounts of money and seized evidences related to the inquiry.
“About 25,000 students were being referred by one entity and more than 10,000 students by another entity to various colleges based outside India every year.”

The ED's ongoing investigation emphasizes the serious nature of human trafficking and the exploitation of Indian nationals seeking migration opportunities.

item.title: Sexual assault on Anna University campus: Opposition parties stage protests in Chennai; Jayakumar, Tamilisai detained - The Hindu
item.description:
Protests Erupt in Chennai Over Sexual Assault on Anna University Student

Published Date: December 26, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Members of the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) staged protests in Chennai against the alleged sexual assault of a student on the Anna University campus, condemning the ruling DMK government.

  • Hundreds of protesters, including AIADMK leaders, demonstrated in front of Anna University.
  • Traffic disruptions occurred during the protests as demonstrators alleged security lapses.
  • AIADMK leader Edappadi K. Palaniswami questioned the safety measures in place on campus.
  • BJP members also protested, claiming the government failed to protect the identity of the survivor.
“How can one believe that the CCTV cameras in Tamil Nadu’s premier higher educational institute were not working?” - Edappadi K. Palaniswami

The protests emphasize rising concerns over student safety and accountability of the authorities in handling such incidents.

item.title: India map distorted at Belagavi Congress meet? BJP launches attack - Deccan Herald
item.description:
BJP Criticizes Congress for Allegedly Distorted Map at Belagavi Meeting

Published on: 26 December 2024, 07:41 IST

The Congress is holding a significant Working Committee meeting in Belagavi, Karnataka, to mark the 100th anniversary of the historic Belgaum session. However, the event has attracted criticism from the BJP, which claims Congress disrespected India's sovereignty by displaying a distorted map depicting Kashmir as part of Pakistan.

  • The Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting in Belagavi is notable for its historical significance.
  • The BJP accuses the Congress of showing disrespect for India’s sovereignty.
  • Key BJP leaders, including MP Sudhanshu Trivedi, voice strong criticisms against Congress's actions.
  • Shehzad Poonawalla remarks on Congress's alleged alignment with forces dividing India.
  • The Congress plans to address the issue of disrespect to B R Ambedkar during the meetings.
“This clearly shows Congress’ alliance with the forces that are dividing India into parts.” — Sudhanshu Trivedi
“Once again Congress sings Pakistan tune… They do not believe in Bharat Jodo or Sanvidhan but Bharat Todo.” — Shehzad Poonawalla

The Congress insists on protecting Mahatma Gandhi's legacy amid these criticisms, as the party continues with its planned events in Belagavi.

item.title: AAP-Delhi Congress conflict puts INDIA bloc on shaky grounds - The Hindu
item.description:
AAP-Delhi Congress Conflict Puts INDIA Bloc on Shaky Grounds

Published: December 26, 2024 12:32 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is considering withdrawing from the INDIA alliance if Congress does not act against its leader Ajay Maken, who has been criticized for his statements against AAP and for allegedly collaborating with the BJP.

  • AAP officials, including Chief Minister Atishi, expressed dissatisfaction with Congress's actions.
  • AAP claims Maken is echoing BJP sentiments and demands his removal from the alliance.
  • Atishi accused Congress candidates of receiving financial support from the BJP for Delhi Assembly elections.
  • Maken publicly stated it was a mistake for Congress to align with AAP in the recent elections.
“We demand the Congress to take action against Ajay Maken in 24 hours, else we will demand other parties in the INDIA bloc to remove Congress from the alliance.” - Sanjay Singh

The ongoing conflict raises questions about the stability of the INDIA bloc and the future of cooperation among these political parties amidst accusations and allegations.

item.title: Uttar Pradesh: Fire breaks out at Greater Noida hospital - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Fire Breaks Out at Greater Noida Hospital

Publication Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A major fire broke out at a private hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida, causing panic among patients and staff as efforts were initiated to control the situation. Fortunately, no casualties were reported.

  • The fire incident occurred amidst a previous fire outbreak at an electronic equipment manufacturing company in Noida.
  • Thousands of rupees worth of goods were destroyed in the December 22 incident.
  • The fire department responded promptly with 17 vehicles and approximately 100 firefighters.
  • The blaze was contained after five hours of firefighting efforts.
  • The cause of the fire is believed to be sparks from electrical equipment and stored batteries.
No casualties were reported, and the total damage is still being assessed.

This incident highlights ongoing fire safety concerns at commercial facilities, emphasizing the need for better preventative measures and response protocols.

item.title: GST on selling old cars FAQs: From impact on dealers and individuals to tax calculation—all your questions answered | Mint - Mint
item.description:
GST on Selling Old Cars FAQs: From Impact on Dealers and Individuals to Tax Calculation

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

The recent increase in the Goods and Services Tax (GST) on used cars to 18% has generated significant discussion regarding its impact on pricing and individuals involved in the used vehicle market.

  • The GST Council has increased the tax on used vehicles from 12% to 18%.
  • When individuals sell cars to other individuals, no GST is applicable.
  • GST will be applicable on margins when used cars are sold through dealers or platforms.
  • This increase is likely to raise costs for used cars sold through platforms while leaving individual sales unaffected.
  • Used car dealers are expected to bear the brunt of the price hikes and may pass costs onto consumers.
  • For used electric vehicles (EVs), a standard 18% GST is also applied.
“This move to harmonize tax slabs is likely to impact startup margins in the short term.” - Samiksha Goel and Sneha Shah

The increase in GST rates on used cars will have varied impacts; while individual sellers may remain unaffected, used car dealers could see a decline in business due to increased costs. Monitoring the responses of dealers and platforms will be crucial in evaluating the long-term effects of this tax change.

item.title: Massive traffic jam near north Bengaluru mall on Christmas, people walk 3 km abandoning vehicles - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Massive Traffic Jam Near North Bengaluru Mall on Christmas

Date: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The popular mall in North Bengaluru attracted a massive crowd on Christmas evening, leading to significant traffic issues in the area, causing many visitors to abandon their vehicles and walk 3 kilometers to reach the mall.

  • The luxury mall in Yelahanka has a history of causing traffic congestion.
  • Inadequate parking forced visitors to park far from the mall.
  • Bengaluru Traffic Police advised commuters to take alternate routes.
  • Social media highlighted the chaos, with users sharing videos and experiences of the long traffic jam.
  • Last year, local police ordered the mall to reduce visitor numbers due to similar issues.
“People had to leave their vehicles and walk 3 km to reach the mall. Yesterday was a traffic nightmare for commuters.”

The incident highlights ongoing concerns regarding traffic management and infrastructure challenges related to the mall's location.

item.title: Massive traffic jam near Bengaluru's Phoenix Mall of Asia on Christmas, people walk 3 km abandoning vehicles - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Traffic Chaos Near Bengaluru Mall on Christmas Leads to 3 km Walk for Visitors

Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

On Christmas evening, a massive influx of visitors to a luxury mall in North Bengaluru caused significant traffic chaos, forcing many to abandon their vehicles and walk up to 3 kilometers to reach the mall.

  • Inadequate parking at the mall contributed to the situation, with visitors parking far away.
  • Bengaluru Traffic Police advised commuters to use alternate routes due to severe congestion.
  • Social media reactions highlighted the frustration of visitors, with reports of bumper-to-bumper traffic and crowded conditions inside the mall.
  • Local concerns were raised about the mall's location leading to frequent traffic snarls in the area.
  • This is not the first time the mall has faced scrutiny for causing traffic issues, with previous directives from police to manage congestion.
“People had to leave their vehicles and walk 3 km to reach the mall. Yesterday was a traffic nightmare for commuters.”

The incident underscores ongoing traffic challenges in Bengaluru, especially during peak shopping seasons like the holidays.

item.title: Egg thrown at a Bengaluru BJP MLA Munirathna, three detained - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Egg thrown at Bengaluru BJP MLA Munirathna, three detained

Date: Dec 26, 2024 10:22 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

BJP MLA and former Karnataka minister Munirathna was attacked with eggs while attending an event in his constituency. The incident sparked outrage and led to the detention of three suspects.

  • BJP MLA Munirathna was attending an event when miscreants threw eggs at him.
  • He was recently released on bail in a rape case.
  • After the incident, Munirathna accused the Congress party of plotting to kill him.
  • Three suspects were detained by Bengaluru police in connection with the attack.
  • An FIR had been registered against Munirathna related to the rape case he is involved in.
“It is evident that the Congress party is trying to kill me. DK Shivakumar is already laying a plan and today’s incident is the proof for their vile plan.” - Munirathna

This incident highlights the growing tensions in Karnataka's political landscape and raises questions about the safety of public figures amid ongoing political rivalry.

item.title: Donald Trump's AI head Sriram Krishnan bats to remove country caps for Green Cards; here's why it is good - The Times of India
item.description:
Donald Trump's AI head Sriram Krishnan bats to remove country caps for Green Cards; here's why it is good news for Indians

Publication Date: Not available Source: Not available

In a significant development, Sriram Krishnan, who leads AI initiatives for Donald Trump, is advocating for the removal of country caps for Green Cards, a move that could have positive implications for Indian applicants.

  • Krishnan's proposed changes aim to simplify the Green Card process.
  • The removal of country caps is expected to accelerate the immigration process for many individuals.
  • Advocates believe this would positively impact the tech industry, which relies heavily on skilled immigrants.
"This change could reshape the landscape of opportunities for skilled professionals from India."

The initiative, if realized, could lead to a more equitable immigration system beneficial for many skilled workers.

item.title: TS TET hall ticket 2024 today at tgtet2024.aptonline.in, here's how to download admit cards when released - Hindustan Times
item.description:
TS TET Hall Ticket 2024 Release Today

Publication Date: December 26, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Telangana School Education Department will release hall tickets for the Telangana Teacher Eligibility Test (TS TET) today, December 26. The exam is scheduled from January 1 to January 20, 2025.

  • Hall ticket release date: December 26
  • Exam dates: January 1 - January 20, 2025
  • Result announcement: February 5, 2025
  • Exam timings: 9 AM to 11:30 AM and 2 PM to 4:30 PM

How to Download TS TET Hall Ticket 2024

  1. Visit tgtet2024.aptonline.in
  2. Click on the download link for the TS TET admit card displayed on the homepage.
  3. Enter your login credentials.
  4. Submit and download the hall ticket.
  5. Review the instructions provided on the hall ticket.
  6. Print the hall ticket for exam day.

The minimum eligibility requirement includes having a DElEd, DEd, BEd, or equivalent qualification. The TS TET pass certificate is required to apply for teacher posts in various schools across Telangana.

item.title: Orry says he is 18% after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman revises GST rate on caramelised popcorn - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Orry Highlights 18% GST on Caramelised Popcorn After Tax Revision

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Orry, also known as Orhan Awatramani, engages with the latest social media trend following Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's announcement of revised GST rates for caramelised popcorn.

  • The GST rate on caramelised popcorn with added sugar is set at 18%.
  • Unpackaged and unlabelled popcorn mixed with salt and spices remains at 5% GST.
  • Orry humorously comments on the different GST rates in a viral video.
  • Memes and comments from fans highlight the fun surrounding this announcement.
“Caramel popcorn is injurious to financial health.” - Orry

The viral nature of Orry's video and the humorous comments show the public's engagement with the new tax regulations.

item.title: On Camera: 6-Year-Old Narrowly Escapes Death As Car Runs Over Him In Maharashtra's Vasai - News18
item.description:
On Camera: 6-Year-Old Narrowly Escapes Death As Car Runs Over Him In Maharashtra's Vasai

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: News18

A six-year-old boy narrowly escaped death after a cab ran over him in Vasai, Maharashtra. The shocking incident was captured on CCTV.

  • The boy was playing near a parked car when the driver turned on the engine.
  • Despite being run over, the child managed to stand up.
  • Nearby children rushed to help him after the accident.
  • The cab driver continued driving, oblivious to the incident.
  • The child's parents filed a complaint against the driver after viewing the footage.
  • The boy is currently receiving treatment for his injuries.
“According to the details, the parents of the child registered a complaint against the cab driver after they saw the entire footage of the incident.”

The incident has raised concerns about child safety and driver responsibility in densely populated areas.

item.title: Dense fog envelops Delhi as IMD issues yellow alert; train operations affected - The Times of India
item.description:
Dense fog envelops Delhi as IMD issues yellow alert; train operations affected

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

In October 2023, dense fog covered Delhi, leading the India Meteorological Department (IMD) to issue a yellow alert. This weather phenomenon significantly disrupted train operations.

  • Visibility levels dropped significantly due to heavy fog.
  • The IMD's yellow alert indicates potential issues related to fog in the coming days.
  • Train schedules were affected, with delays reported across various services.
“Travelers should remain cautious as visibility may further decrease,” warned an IMD official.

This severe weather event highlights the ongoing challenges posed by fog in major metropolitan areas like Delhi, affecting daily commutes and transport services.

item.title: What happened to Ranveer Allahbadia, his girlfriend at Goa beach? YouTuber recounts horror - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ranveer Allahbadia's Near-Drowning Experience in Goa

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

On December 25, popular YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia, known as 'Beerbiceps', shared a harrowing account of a near-drowning incident that occurred while he and his girlfriend were swimming at a Goa beach. Despite their swimming skills, they were swept away by a powerful underwater current and needed rescue.

  • Ranveer and his girlfriend were swept away by an underwater current while swimming.
  • They struggled for 5-10 minutes before calling for help.
  • They were rescued by a family that included an IPS officer and an IRS officer.
  • Ranveer expressed deep gratitude for their rescue and shared insights on life and gratitude through social media.
“This experience left us feeling both blank as well as grateful. We felt the protection of God throughout the incident.”

This incident profoundly changed Ranveer's perspective on life and reinforced a sense of gratitude for being alive.

item.title: What happened to Ranveer Allahbadia at Goa beach? YouTuber recounts horror - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ranveer Allahbadia's Harrowing Drowning Experience in Goa

Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

On December 25, 2024, Ranveer Allahbadia, better known as 'Beerbiceps', shared an Instagram post recounting a terrifying drowning incident he experienced with his girlfriend at a Goa beach. Both nearly drowned due to a strong underwater current but were saved by nearby swimmers, including an IPS officer and his IRS wife.

  • Ranveer described the event as the most eventful Christmas of his life.
  • He and his girlfriend were swept away while swimming in the ocean.
  • Despite being strong swimmers, they struggled for 5-10 minutes.
  • They were rescued after calling for help from nearby swimmers.
“There was a point during the ordeal where I swallowed a lot of water and started fading away a little bit. That's when I decided to shout for help.”

This incident profoundly changed Ranveer's perspective on life, as he expressed deep gratitude for being alive and the support they received during the ordeal.

item.title: Cold Wave In North India Intensifies, Delhi Airport Issues Advisory, 18 Trains Delayed: Top Weather Updates - News18
item.description:
Cold Wave In North India Intensifies, Delhi Airport Issues Advisory, 18 Trains Delayed: Top Weather Updates

Date: December 26, 2024
Source: News18

North India is facing an intense cold wave, with significant drops in temperature and travel disruptions. The Kashmir valley is experiencing its harshest winter period known as 'Chillai-Kalan'.

  • Delhi recorded a minimum temperature of 8.4 degrees Celsius, which is significantly lower than normal.
  • Low visibility was reported at the Delhi Airport, but flight operations remained normal.
  • At least 18 trains heading to Delhi have been delayed due to dense fog.
  • Kashmir temperatures have dropped further, with predictions for additional drops over the next few days.
  • In Punjab, temperatures recorded were at or below 5 degrees Celsius in several areas.
  • Cold wave conditions are also affecting Himachal Pradesh and parts of Rajasthan.
“Low Visibility Procedures are in progress at Delhi Airport. All flight operations are presently normal.”

The cold wave is expected to continue, urging people to stay updated on travel conditions and prepare for worsening weather next week.

item.title: Lamborghini luxury car catches fire on Mumbai road, Gautam Singhania posts video raising safety concerns - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Lamborghini Luxury Car Catches Fire on Mumbai Road Raises Safety Concerns

Date: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Gautam Singhania, chairman of the Raymond Group, shared a video of a Lamborghini engulfed in flames on Mumbai's Coastal Road, raising concerns about the safety standards of high-end luxury cars.

  • No injuries were reported by police from the incident around 10:20 PM.
  • The fire department responded quickly, extinguishing the flames in approximately 45 minutes.
  • Singhania questioned the reliability of Lamborghini and advised caution to potential buyers.
  • Social media was flooded with videos of the incident.
  • Lamborghini's recall campaign emphasizes its commitment to safety.
“Incidents like this raise serious concerns about the reliability and safety standards of Lamborghini. For the price and reputation, one expects uncompromising quality - not potential hazards.” - Gautam Singhania

The disturbing incident has sparked public debate regarding the safety of luxury vehicles, indicating a need for more stringent safety measures.
